column3: Ancient authors, in French, with links to French translations:
Périple d’Hannon en Afrique de l’Ouest
Periplus Maris Erythraei - Périple en Mer Erythrée (Red Sea)
ANONYMOUS (perhaps dated between the 5th and 6th century AD, after Pascal Arnaud, Genoa, 2004)
Les Argonautiques en Méditerranée en Mer Noire
Histoire des Guerres Civiles de la République Romaine
Périple de l'Océan Indien et de la Mer Noire
Deipnosophistes or Le Banquet des Savants
DIONYSIUS of HALICARNASSUS (ca. 60 av J-C. - 8 AD)
Les Argonautiques en Méditerranée et Mer Noire
LUC the EVANGELIST (said St LUC) (1st century AD)
Périple en Europe, Asie et Libye (by Pseudo-Scylax, probably around 330 BC, see note below)
Orbis Descriptio (Circuit de la terre ou Periodos)
Amours de Clitophon et de Leucippe
Histoire de la Guerre du Péloponnèse

The "real" Scylax performed a periplus around the Persian empire around 515 BC. His text was lost but is mentioned by Herodotus. Another sailor, "Pseudo-Scylax", performed a periplus around the Mediterranean Sea around 330 BC and this text was preserved.
